    • Constructor Detail

      • BeforeUpgradeVersionTrigger

        protected BeforeUpgradeVersionTrigger(int minorVersionWhenTriggerIsApplicable)
        Parameters:
        minorVersionWhenTriggerIsApplicable - This is the minor version from the metadata.properties file or extensions.properties. Typically, one would bump the number by 1 in the file and use the new number here.

    • Method Detail

      • getTable

        protected final IBeforeUpgradeTable getTable(java.lang.String tableName)
        Overrides:
        getTable in class BeforeUpgradeVersionAction
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of a table. If this isn't the full name (i.e. with prefix), it is assumed to be a main table, i.e. the table prefix will be prepended to the given name. This parameter can contain the full name of a main table, or an extension table, or a typelist table or a staging table.
        Returns:
        An object that the caller can use to operate on tables

      • refreshDatabaseSchema

        protected final void refreshDatabaseSchema()
        Refreshes the in-memory copy of the database schema

      • execute

        public abstract void execute()
        Executes the necessary transformations

      • hasVersionCheck

        public abstract boolean hasVersionCheck()
        Returns:
        true if this version trigger has an associated version check. Please override createVersionCheck().

      • createVersionCheck

        public BeforeUpgradeVersionCheck createVersionCheck()
        Only called if hasVersionCheck() returns true. In this case, it must return the associated version check.
        Returns:
        The associated version check if hasVersionCheck() returns true.

      • executeRawSelectSQL

        protected final java.util.List<java.lang.Object[]> executeRawSelectSQL(JdbcType[] types,
                                                                       java.lang.String sql)
        Executes the given SELECT SQL statement. This method requires the list of types for the columns (in order) returned by the query. The results are returned as a List of Object array. Each array in the list is a row from the SELECT. Each item in the array is a column, in the same order as selected.
        Parameters:
        types - array of JdbcTypes for each column selected
        sql - raw sql statement
        Returns:
        List of Object array for each row returned by the query

      • executeRawUpdateSQL

        protected final int executeRawUpdateSQL(java.lang.String sql)
        Executes the given update SQL statement, either DML (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE) or DDL.
        Parameters:
        sql - raw sql statement
        Returns:
        number of rows affected by statement
